title: SECR football coach to select Indian team for U-17 World Cup
text:
BILASPUR: Shantanu Ghosh, a footballer working in the commercial department of SECR zonal office, has been selected as one of the selectors for the Indian team for U17 football world cup to be held in 2017. This is the first time that a football coach from Chhattisgarh has been entrusted with selection of the Indian team for a world cup event.
Ghosh will be working with chief coach of Indian team Adam Nocholai from England. Speaking to TOI Ghosh informed that in order to spot talent he would be touring states of Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand in the first phase. In Chhattisgarh he would visit football academies in Narayanpur in Bastar, Jashpur and Surguja besides various schools.
"Yes there are some boys here in Bilaspur too who have shown potential and I would be watching them as well, "said Ghosh when asked about there being any prospects from Bilaspur too.
Ghosh informed that in the second phase he would be touring other states as well for taping talent. At the same time he would be focusing on U15 I-league to be held in November. Players who would participate in the said league will turn 17 by the time U17 world cup arrives. Keeping this in view players from this league will be selected for training. Those so selected will undergo an 18 month residential training, said Ghosh.
Ghosh has got 'A' license from AFC (Asian Football Confederation) to be recognized as top grade football coach. There are four grades A, B, C and D, with A being the top grade. Ghosh is also an instructor for providing 'D' licenses. According to him there are less 100 football coaches in India who have got the 'A' license from AFC. He is also only such coach in Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Odisha and Vidrabha regions.
